ODEObject Class Reference
[Physics simulation support library (ODE C++ wrapper)]

#include <ODEObject.h>

Inheritance diagram for ODEObject:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Simple wrapper for ODE collision geometry and simulated rigid body.

The class uses meshes bounding volume and triangle information to calculate requested rigid body objects for the simulation. The class also takes care of mapping transformations between visual meshes and simulated rigid bodies.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ODEObject::GeomType

Geometry type used in simulation.

Enumerator:
GEOM_SPHERE  Sphere.

GEOM_BOX  Box.

GEOM_TRIMESH  Triangle mesh.

GEOM_DEFAULT  Defaults to triangle mesh.

enum ODEObject::MassType

Describes how mass of the object is defined.

Enumerator:
MASS_INFINITE  Object with infinite mass has no simulated body at all.

MASS_DENSITY  Mass is specified relative to body size (e.g.

water 1 kg/L).

MASS_TOTAL  Mass is specified as absolute value.

static void ODEObject::parseProperties ( NS(hgr, Mesh)*  mesh,
const NS(lang, String)&  props,
GeomType *  geomtype,
MassType *  masstype,
float *  mass 
) [static]

Parses ODEObject object properties from user property string.

User property can contains set of assignments separated with newline, for example: body=box
mass=10

Whitespace is ignored, so for example valid string is "body=box\n mass=10".

Supported property strings:

  • body=x -- Where x is {box, sphere, trimesh}. If body=x is missing, then level geometry is created, which is solid triangle mesh with infinite mass.
  • density=x -- Mass of body as density value. Default density is 1. Mass and Density are exclusive values.
  • mass=x -- Mass of body as absolute (total) value. Mass and Density are exclusive values.

Exceptions:
Exception
